page.title: 12Doodle Bug on Dedworth cont.
page.content: Soon we arrived home. There was broken glass everywhere, people running around dodging squawking chickens. Dad jumped off his bicycle and carried to his friends."What's been hit?" my father asked one man. "They hit the bloomin' incinerator they built themselves mate," the chap replied as he dashed off. The incinerator had been built by German prisoners of war. Mercifully to my knowledge there was only one casualty of a serious nature the day the Doodle Bug fell on Dedworth and that was the lady who miscarried her baby. She survived to have more babies later. There were many people cut from the flying glass as many windows were blown out. I had no ill effects at all except a lifelong memory of the day the nasty old Doodle Bug stopped little six year old me having a ride on the swings.
